executive_summary: The five years to 2024 have been a strong period for the Nurse Practitioners industry. The Healthcare sector has been struggling with a shortage of nurses and physicians over the past decade. High education costs, skyrocketing demand and high rates of burnout have driven workers out of the sector and deterred students from pursuing careers in healthcare. Nurse practitioners have been a solution to this shortage for hospitals and outpatient care facilities, because nurse practitioners can often provide the same services as physicians at a lower cost.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Physician Shortage Fuels Nurse Practitioner Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past decade, the Healthcare sector has been facing a shortage of nurses and physicians, as skyrocketing demand, high education costs and burnout have driven workers and students away from healthcare. Nurse practitioners have been able to fill gaps in the Healthcare sector left by the physician shortage, because nurse practitioners are able to provide many of the same services as physicians.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: High Demand Leads to Wage Growth for Nurse Practitioners
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As demand for healthcare continues to outpace the sector's labor capacity, hospitals and outpatient care centers have been willing to pay higher wages for nurse practitioners.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Nurse Practitioners Will Continue to Benefit From the Labor Shortage
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In the coming years, the Healthcare sector will continue to face a shortage of nurses and physicians. While healthcare providers will make efforts to address the shortage, it is likely to continue as burnout rates remain high and the cost of education will continue to deter students from pursuing healthcare careers. Nurse practitioners will continue to benefit from the shortage as hospitals and outpatient care facilities will use nurse practitioners to supplement patient capacity.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Telehealth Will Create Further Opportunities for Nurse Practitioners
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the Healthcare sector continues to embrace telehealth services, nurse practitioners will benefit from increased opportunities. Many states allow nurse practitioners to provide primary care services and as regulation surrounding telehealth changes more nurse practitioners will be able to take advantage of this.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry include nurses who are qualified to treat certain medical conditions without the supervision of a doctor.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

opportunities: Number of adults aged 65 and older
threats: Number of people with private health insurance

key_trends: The healthcare labor shortage has created opportunities for nurse practitioners. Nurse practitioners are able to provide many of the same services as physicians at a lower cost.
Nurse practitioners helped patients get through the pandemic
Membership in industry associations opens doors for nurse practitioners
Regulations surrounding nurse practitioners vary between states
Family and general care represents the largest area for nurse practitioners
Geriatric care has been a growing opportunity for nurse practitioners
Nurse practitioners often work with large hospitals and staffing agencies
Nurse practitioners compete with and support physicians

market_segmentation.segment_description: The majority of nurse practitioners in the US work in outpatient settings including physician's offices and outpatient care centers. In these settings, nurse practitioners can work as either contractors or employees.

Nurse practitioners are able to do many of the same duties as physicians, so in hospital settings, nurse practitioners can support patient care while keeping wages low. As the physician shortage has grown, hospitals have increasingly relied on nurse practitioners to provide patient care.

The majority of nurse practitioners in the US work in outpatient settings including physician's offices and outpatient care centers. In these settings, nurse practitioners can work as either contractors or employees.

products_and_services.product_description: Family care includes general and primary care for all people regardless of age.
Geriatric healthcare, including work in nursing homes and assisted living facilities, continues to be the fastest growing specialty in the Healthcare sector.

tier_2_suppliers: Medical Device Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Nurse Practitioners Fill a Gap in Family Care
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The most dominant specialty for nurse practitioners in the US is family care.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Geriatric Medicine Provides a Growing Opportunity for Nurse Practitioners
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Geriatric healthcare continues to be the fastest growing specialty in the Healthcare sector.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region accounts for the largest percentage of nurse practitioner establishments in the US.

basis_points.basis_title: Nurse practitioners often work with large hospitals and staffing agencies
basis_points.basis_description: While some nurse practitioners work in private practice, contract work with healthcare facilities can provide more consistent income.
Nurse practitioners compete with and support physicians.

concentration_points.concentration_description: There are no major players in this industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor Costs Have Grown as Nurse Practitioners Demand Higher Wages
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As the Healthcare sector continues to face a labor shortage, nurse practitioners have been able to generate higher average wages.
Profit for healthcare staffing companies has declined.

volatility_points.volatility_title: VOLATILITY HAS INCREASED AS REVENUE GROWTH HAS ACCELERATED
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since 2019, revenue for nurse practitioners has grown robustly.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Nurse Practitioners Fill a Gap in Family Care
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Family care includes general and primary care.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: GERIATRIC MEDICINE PROVIDES A GROWING OPPORTUNITY FOR NURSE PRACTITIONERS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Demand for geriatric care has outpaced the number of physicians.

FAQs.question: What is the regulation and policy outlook for this industry?
FAQs.answer: The regulation is described as MODERATE and STEADY.

FAQs.question: What is the industry assistance outlook for this industry?
FAQs.answer: The industry assistance is described as MODERATE and STEADY.
